page.title: 16A Public House in Collingham
page.content: The Royal Oak before it became a public house in 1728 was a{coaching {inn.}In 1872 a newspaper advertisement proclaimed "Wines and spirits of the best quality" and "Fishing parties will find first-class accommodation, and can be met at any train and driven to the fishing waters." Today,beer is delivered once a week on Thursdays and wines and spirits once a fortnight.Recently{real ale }has been introduced by public demand,costing{ {67p for one pint of bitter.}Shorts average at 56p a measure and soft drinks 34p. Upstairs there is a very large room which is often used for meetings. Collingham Young Farmers club meets there and so does the fishing club. The licensing hours are limited to{9 {hours a day }excluding Sunday.The Sunday hours are 5 and a half hours.
